Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: Draw two people holding cups with lines representing strings between them. (The student recognizes the basic components of the device.)
CANNOT: Show how sound is transmitted effectively through the string. (The student may not understand that sound travels through vibrations.)
Illustrate how the string needs to be tight to transmit sound efficiently. (The drawing might show a slack or curved string.)
Depict that the device solves the problem of communicating over a long distance. (The student may not connect the concept of distance with the function of the device.)
Include features in the drawing that show how people use simple devices to communicate. (The student might only focus on the cups and string without implying communication.)
Represent the importance of using the provided materials to construct the design solution. (The student may not consider or depict the significance of using cups and string specifically.)
